data.event: The county was formed in 1774 from the southeastern part of Halifax County and the western part of Tyrrell County.

event.title: was named for Josiah Martin, the last royal governor of North Carolina (1771

data.event: It was named for Josiah Martin, the last royal governor of North Carolina (1771â€“75).

event.title: was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979

data.event: The Martin County Courthouse was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979.
In 2008, Barack Obama won the county with 52.2% of the vote.
